author: stsp
msg: * STATUS: Nominate r40400.

author: stsp
msg: Correctly fix issue #2580 on Win32: Don't kill the tunnel agent.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/client.c
(make_tunnel): On Win32, APR translates APR_KILL_ONLY_ONCE to
APR_KILL_ALWAYS, terminating the tunnel agent prematurely and
breaking the SSH and SVN protocol shutdown sequences.
It is actually not necessary to kill the tunnel agent on Windows,
since it will reliably die on its own once svn closes the pipe.
Patch by: Bob Denny <rdenny@dc3.com>
(log message tweaked by me)

author: stsp
msg: Fix application of patches with \ path separators.
* subversion/libsvn_client/patch.c
(resolve_target_path): Instead of running the target path as read from
the patch file through svn_dirent_canonicalize(), run it through
svn_dirent_internal_style(), which should correctly normalise path
separators on Windows. On UNIX, however, svn_dirent_internal_style()
does not change backslashes, so manually normalize paths containing
only \ separators..

author: cmpilato
msg: On the issue-3242-dev branch, rework the way that URL-based copy,
move, and delete operations drive the RA layer to avoid requiring read
access at unnecessarily high directory locations.
* subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(repos_to_repos_copy): Rework this function to avoid trying to
access repository paths higher in the repository tree than required.
(wc_to_repos_copy): Lose unnecessary comments and dead code.
Simplify RA connectivity and make more direct queries of paths.
(repos_to_wc_copy_single): Update handling around
calculate_target_mergeinfo().
(try_copy): Comment tweaks only.
* subversion/libsvn_client/delete.c
(delete_urls): Avoid opening the RA session at the common parents of
to-be-deleted URLs.  Instead, open it at one of the targets and
reparent as necessary.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/tests/cmdline/authz_tests.py
(authz_access_required_at_repo_root): Correct and expand this test.
(Turns out that it's beneficial when writing multi-stage test
logic to actually compensate in a given stage for state changes
made in previous stages, ya know?)
